title: DNA Pioneer James Watson Dies at 97, Leaves Complex Legacy
snippets: James Watson, who co-discovered the structure of DNA has died at age 97. He was a scientific superstar until he made racist remarks that made him an outcast.
James Watson, co-discoverer of DNA's double helix, dead at 97 Reuters
The Nobel Prize winner felt ostracised by the scientific community over his comments on race and intelligence.
Scientist helped break new ground in study of genetics, but later caused outcry with promotion of racist ideas.
The Chicago-born researcher received the 1962 Nobel Prize alongside Francis Crick and Maurice Wilkins.

Colauréat du Nobel 1962 pour une découverte qui a donné le coup d’envoi de la révolution génétique, l’Américain avait terni son image en minimisant le travail de la cristallographe Rosalind Franklin et par ses sorties racistes, sexistes et eugénistes. Le généticien et biochimiste américain est mort
Scientist James Watson, who shared a Nobel prize for helping discover the double-helix shape of the DNA molecule, has died
As one of the most influential scientists of the 20th century, James Watson pioneered the field of genetics and left behind a complicated legacy
James Watson, who co-won the Nobel Prize for discovering DNA's structure, was a towering and controversial figure in science.

Nobel prize winner shaped medicine, crimefighting and genealogy, but later years marred by racist remarks James Dewey Watson, whose co-discovery of the twisted-ladder structure of DNA in 1953 helped light the long fuse on a revolution in medicine, crimefighting, genealogy and ethics, has died, accor

James D. Watson, whose co-discovery of the twisted-ladder structure of DNA in 1953 helped light the long fuse on a revolution in medicine, crimefighting, genealogy and ethics, has died. He was 97. The breakthrough — made when the brash, Chicago-born Watson was just 24 — turned him into a hallowed fi
titles: James Watson, who co-discovered the structure of DNA, has died at age 97
James Watson, co-discoverer of DNA's double helix, dead at 97 - Reuters
DNA pioneer James Watson dies at 97
James Watson, who co-discovered DNA double helix, dies at 97
James Watson, co-discoverer of DNA's double helix, dies
James Watson, codécouvreur de la structure en double hélice de l’ADN, est mort à l’âge de 97 ans
James Watson, co-discoverer of the double-helix shape of DNA, has died at age 97
James Watson, co-discoverer of DNA’s double helix, has died aged 97
James Watson, controversial co-discoverer of DNA's structure, dies at 97
James D Watson, who co-discovered DNA’s twisted-ladder structure, dies aged 97
summary: James Watson, a pioneering scientist who co-discovered the DNA double helix, has died at 97. Awarded the Nobel Prize in 1962 with Francis Crick and Maurice Wilkins, his later years were overshadowed by controversy due to his racist and sexist comments. Despite his significant contributions to genetics and science, his remarks led to widespread criticism and ostracization from the scientific community. Watson's legacy remains complex, marked by groundbreaking achievements and contentious views.

title: Trump Considers Sanction Exemption for Hungary on Russian Oil
snippets: Trump hosts Orban as Hungary seeks exemption on Russian oil sanctions - as it happened Reuters
Trump has recently increased pressure on US allies to curb their spending on Russian oil.
Orbán says Trump will not punish Hungary for buying Russian energy, reducing impact of sanctions AP News
As he met with Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban, US President Donald Trump promised to consider a waiver for Hungary on Russian oil sanctions.
Despite a chummy relationship, new U.S. penalties on Russian energy were likely to be a sticking point as President Trump and Prime Minister Viktor Orban of Hungary met.

summary: During a meeting with Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban, US President Donald Trump agreed to consider granting Hungary an exemption from sanctions on Russian oil. This decision comes amidst Trump's broader push for US allies to reduce their reliance on Russian energy. The exemption, seen as a victory for Orban, aims to mitigate the impact of sanctions on Hungary, highlighting the close relationship between the two leaders despite potential tensions over new US penalties on Russian energy.

snippets: China's third aircraft carrier, the Fujian, enters service Reuters
China announced it has commissioned its third aircraft carrier, the Fujian. With it, China is steadily closing the gap to US naval capabilities in the region.

The Fujian, China’s most advanced carrier, went into official service this week. It brings the country closer to challenging U.S. naval dominance.

summary: China has officially commissioned its third and most advanced aircraft carrier, the Fujian, marking a significant step in expanding its naval capabilities and military influence. This development brings China closer to challenging U.S. naval dominance in the region.

title: Norris Takes Pole in Sao Paulo, Aims to Extend Championship Lead
snippets: Lando Norris secures pole position for the Sao Paulo Grand Prix sprint race with McLaren team-mate and title rival Oscar Piastri in third.
Lando Norris took pole position for Brazil's sprint race in what he will hope will be a weekend he takes a stranglehold on the Formula 1 drivers' championship.
Lando Norris claimed pole position for Saturday's Sprint at the Sao Paulo Grand Prix as his title rivals Oscar Piastri took third and Max Verstappen was only sixth.
Lando Norris set up a chance to pad his one-point lead in Formula 1 by securing pole position for the sprint race at the Brazilian Grand Prix on Saturday.
titles: 'Good start' for Norris as he takes sprint pole
Lando Norris on pole in sprint qualifying
Norris takes Sprint pole with Verstappen only sixth in Sao Paulo
Lando Norris on sprint pole at Brazilian GP
summary: Lando Norris secured pole position for the Sao Paulo Grand Prix sprint race, enhancing his prospects in the Formula 1 drivers' championship. His McLaren teammate and title rival, Oscar Piastri, qualified in third place, while Max Verstappen took sixth. This positioning offers Norris an opportunity to extend his one-point lead in the championship standings.

title: Cornell Pays $60M to Settle Antisemitism Probe, Restores Federal Funds

Cornell University to pay $60M in deal with Trump administration to restore federal funding AP News

Upstate New York institution is the fifth university under government investigation to bow to White House demands Cornell University announced a settlement with the Trump administration on Friday, becoming the fifth university under investigation by the US government to do so. The agreement will see
The agreement ends a government investigation into accusations of antisemitism made against the school, which was one of many that had pro-Palestinian protests on campus last year.

This settlement concludes a government investigation into allegations of antisemitism linked to pro-Palestinian protests on campus. The agreement makes Cornell the fifth university to comply with White House demands under such investigations.

The alleged scheme was thwarted by Mexican authorities, following a deadly Israeli bombing of the Iranian embassy in Syria. The threat has been "contained," according to a U.S. official.

title: Japanese HR King Murakami Enters MLB Posting; Dodgers Interested
snippets: Japanese star third baseman Munetaka Murakami, who owns the single-season home run record for a Japanese player in Nippon Professional Baseball, is entering the posting system for MLB teams, sources told ESPN.
Murakami’s 45-day window to ink a deal will start on Saturday. Many suitors, including the Dodgers, are expected to pursue the Japanese slugger.
Third baseman Munetaka Murakami is reportedly set to be posted on Friday, which will begin his process towards playing in MLB, ESPN’s Jeff Passan reported.

summary: Japanese third baseman Munetaka Murakami, holder of the single-season home run record in Nippon Professional Baseball, is entering the MLB posting system, with a 45-day window to secure a deal starting Saturday. The Dodgers, among others, are interested in signing him, as reported by ESPN.

snippets: Trump orders Justice Department probe of meatpackers over prices Axios
Trump Asks Justice Department to Probe Meatpackers on Prices Bloomberg.com
Trump’s decision to impose a 50% tariffs on products from Brazil over diplomatic disputes also affected their beef exports.

summary: Former President Trump requested the Justice Department to investigate meatpacking companies over pricing concerns, as reported by Axios and Bloomberg. Additionally, Trump imposed a 50% tariff on products from Brazil, including beef exports, due to diplomatic disputes. This action has implications for both the pricing and supply of meat in the market.

World No 1 Aryna Sabalenka overcame Amanda Anisimova 6-3 3-6 6-3 in a gladiatorial battle between big-hitters on Friday to book a WTA Finals title showdown with Elena Rybakina.

World No 1 triumphs 6-3, 3-6, 6-3 in epic semi-final Rybakina battles back to defeat Pegula 4-6, 6-4, 6-3 Aryna Sabalenka will attempt to close out one of the greatest seasons of her career by winning the WTA Finals for the first time as she rekindles her rivalry with Elena Rybakina in the final of

Sabalenka beats Anisimova to book WTA Finals title clash with Rybakina

summary: World No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka defeated Amanda Anisimova 6-3, 3-6, 6-3 in the WTA Finals semi-final, setting up a final against Elena Rybakina. Sabalenka described the victory as great preparation for the decider. She aims to cap off one of the greatest seasons of her career by winning the WTA Finals for the first time.

title: Palantir CEO Clashes with Short Sellers as Shares and Nasdaq Fall
snippets: Palantir CEO Alex Karp twice confronted short sellers this week as the company's shares suffered a double-digit drop.
Nasdaq falls 3% over the five-day period as investors worry about sky-high valuations
Strong tech earnings weren’t enough to reassure investors worried about high valuations.
titles: Palantir CEO Karp twice slams short sellers as stock suffers worst week since April
Tech stocks suffer worst week since April after $800bn AI sell-off
Tech stocks just had their worst week since the April tariff selloff. Why it’s about time.
summary: This week, Palantir CEO Alex Karp confronted short sellers twice amid the company's shares dropping by double digits. Concurrently, the Nasdaq fell 3% over five days due to investor concerns over high valuations, despite strong tech earnings failing to alleviate these worries.

title: US Consumer Sentiment Hits 3.5-Year Low Amid Shutdown, Flight Cuts
snippets: US consumer sentiment near 3-1/2-year low as government shutdown fuels anxiety Reuters
ABC News' Elizabeth Schulze reports on weak financial data raising fresh concerns about the economy.

Travellers forced to adjust their plans as longest shutdown on record continues with no sign of resolution US politics live – latest updates List of US airports cutting flights on Friday A US government order to make drastic cuts in commercial air traffic amid the government shutdown has taken effec
Dollar ends week lower amid Fed outlook, US government shutdown Reuters
titles: US consumer sentiment near 3-1/2-year low as government shutdown fuels anxiety - Reuters
WATCH:  US consumer sentiment nears record lows amid government shutdown
Passengers start to feel bite of flight cuts amid US government shutdown
Dollar ends week lower amid Fed outlook, US government shutdown - Reuters
summary: US consumer sentiment has dropped to a near 3.5-year low, largely due to the ongoing government shutdown, which is also causing significant disruptions in air travel, with mandatory cuts to commercial flights. This situation is raising concerns about the economy, as reflected in weak financial data and a decrease in the dollar's value against other currencies. The government shutdown, now the longest on record, continues without a clear resolution, affecting travelers and contributing to broader economic anxieties.

The UK's National Crime Agency says suspect was a former soldier who was arrested on Thursday by specialist officers.

Robert Purkiss, 38, who is origina
titles: British ex-soldier arrested over alleged murder of Kenyan woman in 2012

Former British soldier fights extradition to Kenya over alleged murder
summary: Robert James Purkiss, a former soldier, was arrested in the UK and faces extradition over the alleged murder of Agnes Wanjiru near a British army base in Kenya in 2012. He appeared in court as extradition proceedings began. The National Crime Agency conducted the arrest.

title: Typhoon Kalmaegi Kills 193 in Philippines, Vietnam
snippets: Typhoon Kalmaegi brings rain and destruction to Vietnam as death toll nears 200 in Philippines Reuters
Typhoon Kalmaegi wreaked havoc as it swept through low-lying areas of the Philippines, overturning trees and cars.

At least five people died in Vietnam after Typhoon Kalmaegi pummelled coastal regions with destructive winds and heavy rain, officials said on Friday, following the storm's deadly passage through the Philippines where it killed at least 188 people.
titles: Typhoon Kalmaegi brings rain and destruction to Vietnam as death toll nears 200 in Philippines - Reuters
Philippine death toll from devastating typhoon nears 200
Typhoon Kalmaegi brings rain and destruction to Vietnam as death toll nears 190 in Philippines
summary: Typhoon Kalmaegi caused significant destruction in the Philippines and Vietnam, resulting in at least 188 deaths in the Philippines and 5 in Vietnam. The storm brought heavy rain and destructive winds, overturning trees and cars in low-lying areas.

title: Tanzania Charges 145 with Treason After Election Protests
snippets: Exclusive: Tanzania charges 145 people with treason over election protests, filings show Reuters
Church leader Benson Bagonza says the move would only deepen the acrimony sparked by the election.

More than 100 people were accused of "intention to obstruct" an October 29 election in which President Samia Suluhu Hassan ran virtually unopposed. The opposition says hundreds were killed in post-election violence.
titles: Exclusive: Tanzania charges 145 people with treason over election protests, filings show - Reuters
Tanzania charges dozens with treason over election protests
Tanzania accuses scores of 'treason' over election protests
summary: Tanzania has charged 145 individuals with treason following protests related to the October 29 election, where President Samia Suluhu Hassan faced little opposition. Church leader Benson Bagonza criticized the charges, suggesting they would worsen tensions from an election already marred by violence, with the opposition reporting hundreds dead.

title: Ottawa Approves $418.8M Lansdowne 2.0 Project After Intense Debates
snippets: Lansdowne 2.0 cleared its final hurdle at Ottawa city hall Friday, as council approved the $419-million redevelopment project.

Following weeks of heated debates, marathon committee sessions and fiery public delegations, councillors gave the green light to the massive $418.8 million Lansdowne 2.0 redevelopment project in a narrow vote. A special session of council on Nov. 7 saw 15 councillors vote in favour of Lansdowne 2.0
City councillors introduced several motions before voting on whether to proceed with Lansdowne 2.0. Here's how they voted.
After weeks of contentious debate, city council decided to go ahead with Lansdowne 2.0.
titles: Lansdowne 2.0 approved in final council vote
Council passes Lansdowne 2.0 after close 15-10 vote
How council voted on key amendments to Lansdowne 2.0
As it happened: Council votes to approve Lansdowne 2.0
summary: Ottawa City Council approved the $418.8 million Lansdowne 2.0 redevelopment project after weeks of intense debate and marathon committee sessions. The final vote, held in a special session on November 7, saw 15 councillors in favor, clearing the project's last hurdle at city hall.

title: Nets' Top Scorer Cam Thomas Out 3-4 Weeks with Hamstring Injury
snippets: Cam Thomas will miss at least the next three to four weeks with a left hamstring strain, the Nets announced Friday.
The Brooklyn Nets will be without their leading scorer as they try to reverse their early-season fortunes.

summary: Cam Thomas, the Brooklyn Nets' leading scorer, will be sidelined for three to four weeks due to a left hamstring strain, the team announced. This comes as the Nets aim to improve their performance following a challenging start to the season.

title: Mac Jones to Start as 49ers QB Against Rams, Purdy's Return Uncertain
snippets: While quarterback Brock Purdy slowly works his way back from injury, the 49ers will once again turn to Mac Jones as the starter for Sunday's NFC West showdown against the Rams.
Jones will make his eighth start as Purdy's long-term outlook remains murky

summary: Mac Jones is set to start as quarterback for the 49ers in the upcoming NFC West game against the Rams, marking his eighth start. This decision comes as Brock Purdy continues his recovery from an injury, leaving his return timeline uncertain.

title: China Resumes Nexperia Chip Exports, Easing Dutch Tensions
snippets: Nexperia has been the subject of an ongoing row between Dutch and Chinese authorities. Western carmakers have warned the company's components are critical for the onboarding of electronics.

summary: Nexperia, caught in a dispute between Dutch and Chinese authorities, plays a crucial role in supplying components for Western carmakers. Following negotiations, China has agreed to resume exports of Nexperia chips, as stated by Dutch PM Schoof. This development has led to a de-escalation of tensions, with the Netherlands indicating readiness to relax its control over Nexperia if chip supplies continue without interruption.

title: Fed May Cut Rates to Avoid Slowing Economy, Miran Eyes Stablecoin Impact
snippets: The central banker said the Fed might need to lower its own policy rate to avoid unintentionally slowing the economy.
Fed’s Miran Says Stablecoins to Put Downward Pressure on Rates Bloomberg.com

Fed’s Miran Says Stablecoins to Put Downward Pressure on Rates - Bloomberg.com
summary: A central banker indicated that the Federal Reserve may need to reduce its policy rate to prevent inadvertently decelerating the economy. Additionally, Fed's Miran highlighted that stablecoins are expected to exert downward pressure on rates, according to Bloomberg.com.

title: Death Valley Plant Survives 120°F by Altering Photosynthesis, Study Finds
snippets: In the blistering heat of Death Valley, Tidestromia oblongifolia thrives where few lifeforms can survive. Researchers at Michigan State University found that this plant rewires its photosynthesis and gene expression to thrive under temperatures that cripple most crops. Its cells and enzymes adapt wi

In California's Death Valley, where summer temperatures regularly soar above 120 degrees Fahrenheit, life seems almost impossible. Yet among the cracked earth and blinding sunlight, one native plant not only survives—it thrives.
titles: This Death Valley Plant Thrives in 120°F Heat and Could Save Future Crops
Death Valley plant yields blueprint for building heat-resilient crops
summary: Researchers at Michigan State University discovered that Tidestromia oblongifolia, a plant native to Death Valley, California, can thrive in extreme temperatures exceeding 120 degrees Fahrenheit. The plant adapts by altering its photosynthesis and gene expression, enabling it to survive in conditions that are lethal to most crops. This adaptation highlights its unique resilience in one of the harshest environments on Earth.

title: US Congressional Budget Office Hit by Cybersecurity Breach
snippets: US Congressional Budget Office hit by cybersecurity incident Reuters

The congressional research office confirmed a breach, but did not comment on the cause. A security researcher suggested the hack may have originated because CBO failed to patch a firewall for more than a year.
titles: US Congressional Budget Office hit by cybersecurity incident - Reuters
Congressional Budget Office confirms it was hacked
summary: The US Congressional Budget Office experienced a cybersecurity breach. The exact cause is unconfirmed, but a security researcher indicated it might be due to an unpatched firewall for over a year. The office has acknowledged the incident but has not provided details on the breach's impact.

title: Astronomers Witness Record-Breaking Black Hole Flare 10 Billion Light-Years Away
snippets: A colossal black hole 10 billion light-years away has been caught devouring one of the universe’s biggest stars, unleashing a flare 30 times brighter than any seen before. The flare, detected by Caltech’s ZTF, likely marks a tidal disruption event — when a star is shredded by a black hole’s gravity.
Astronomers spotted a flaring black hole that may be consuming a star at least 30 times more massive than the sun. At its peak, the flare was brighter than 10 trillion stars.
titles: Black hole blast outshines 10 trillion Suns
'Unlike any we've ever seen': Record-breaking black hole eruption is brighter than 10 trillion suns
summary: Astronomers using Caltech's ZTF have observed a black hole 10 billion light-years away consuming a star over 30 times the mass of the sun, causing a flare brighter than 10 trillion stars. This event, likely a tidal disruption event, produced a flare 30 times brighter than any previously observed, marking a significant discovery in the study of black holes and their interactions with stars.

title: New Android Spyware Targeted Samsung Galaxy Users for a Year
snippets: A newly identified Android spyware targeted Galaxy devices for close to a year, including users in the Middle East, researchers exclusively tell TechCrunch.
Targeted attack could steal all of a phone's data and activate camera or mic.
titles: ‘Landfall’ spyware abused zero-day to hack Samsung Galaxy phones
Commercial spyware “Landfall” ran rampant on Samsung phones for almost a year
summary: Researchers have discovered a new Android spyware that targeted Samsung Galaxy devices for nearly a year, primarily affecting users in the Middle East. This spyware could access all data on the phone and activate the device's camera or microphone.

title: 7-Foot-9 Olivier Rioux Debuts as Tallest Collegiate Player Ever
snippets: Florida's Olivier Rioux Makes History as Tallest CBB Player Ever After Debut vs. UNF Bleacher Report

7-foot-9 walk-on Olivier Rioux, the world’s tallest teenager, made his collegiate debut. The 19-year-old Gators freshman got the loudest ovation of the night when he pulled off his warmup jersey and entered the game with 2:09 to play.
titles: Florida's Olivier Rioux Makes History as Tallest CBB Player Ever After Debut vs. UNF - Bleacher Report
Canada’s Olivier Rioux makes history as tallest DI player in Florida win
summary: Olivier Rioux, standing at 7-foot-9, made history as the tallest collegiate basketball player ever during his debut with the Florida Gators against UNF. The 19-year-old walk-on received significant applause when he entered the game with just over two minutes left to play.
